revised_title: Separate Enumerations of Primes of the Form 4n + 1 and 4n + 3
tldr: The author conducted separate enumerations of prime numbers of the forms 4n + 1 and 4n + 3 for seven groups of 100,000 numbers. The results show the differences in properties between these two forms of prime numbers and provide insights into their enumeration and potential errors. This work originated from the ideas of Professor Tchebycheff and M. Edouard Lucas.
